item.title: OpenElec: Multimedia Solution for Raspberry Pi
item.description:
Software version 3.0 (2.99.2)
Operating System Linux
Website OpenElec Website
Last Update 12/02/2013
Others Raspberry Pi B

Introduction link

OpenELEC is an embedded GNU/Linux distribution aimed at allowing the use of a media center (HTPC — Home Theatre PC) in the same way as any other device connected to your television, such as a DVD player or external digital TV receiver. Turn on your device and OpenELEC is ready to use in less than 10 seconds — as fast as some DVD players. All you need is a simple remote control to access its functions.

item.title: Video Conversions
item.description:
Introduction link

mencoder is one of the most used applications along with ffmpeg to convert or encode videos.

Installation link

Depending on what you will use, select only the one you wish:

 apt-get install mencoder ffmpeg

If you want to create OGV (OGG/Theora) videos for HTML5, you need to install this package:

 aptitude install ffmpeg2theora

Usage link

Convert a .wmv to a .avi link

 mencoder "/path/to/file.wmv" -ofps 23.976 -ovc lavc -oac copy -o "/path/to/file.avi"

Convert a .mp4 to a .avi link

 ffmpeg -i "/path/to/file.mp4" "/path/to/file.avi"

item.title: MediaTomb: Setting up a multimedia (UPnP) server
item.description:
Introduction link

MediaTomb is a multimedia server capable of streaming movies, music, and photos. It’s very practical for game consoles like Xbox360 or PlayStation 3, but has many other uses as well.

For example, if you have a machine that contains movies but isn’t connected to your TV screen, you need something to relay the content. This is where a PlayStation 3, for instance, comes in. However, it needs to know where to find the movies, so you need to install a UPnP server on your machine.
